newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Atlas says new firm to assume debts.
newsitem.headline: Atlas says new firm to assume debts.

text.p: Atlas Consolidated Mining and Development Corp said on Tuesday a new investor group, Minoro Mining and Exploration Corp, had reached an agreement in principle with its creditors to assume its 3.7-billion peso debt.
Minoro Mining, which is a Filipino firm led by mining engineer Frank Lubbock, will be issued new shares of Atlas at 10 pesos per share to become the largest shareholder, Atlas said in a statement.

"Final settlement is expected to take place early in the fourth quarter of 1997 at which time Atlas will be virtually debt free and in a strong position to progress with the rehabilitation of its wholly owned Toledo copper mine," it said in a statement.
Atlas said it has appointed Rothschild Australia Ltd and ABN Amro Hoare Govett as its financial advisers.
Atlas, Minoro and the financial advisers have started sourcing funds to bring back the Carmen copper mine in Toledo city, Cebu province back into full scale production.
Atlas' Carmen copper mine was shut down in 1994 after a massive mudflow.
The firm said it planned to reopen the mine at a production rate of 42,000 tonnes of ore per day. It did not give a specific timetable for the commercial production of the mine.
